fields.name: propertySearch
fields.description: Search for hotels and vacation rentals

args.name: dateRange
args.description: The date range representing the hotel stay, if absent the default [today, today+1d] is used

args.name: legacyCriteria
args.description: Legacy input for url values

args.name: pwaLegacySort
args.description:
DEPRECATED: `sort` takes priority over this argument. Pass a simple string
value, like 'name' that will get mapped to a PropertySort enum. We need to
support the old url values and not all values can be stored in a Kotlin enum

args.name: searchPagination
args.description: Search properties using pagination. The minimum results per page is 4, as defined in LSSS

fields.name: shortlist
fields.description: Top level shortlist query

fields.description: Top level customer query

fields.name: travelEntities
fields.description: Exposes shared data such as phone countries, airport list, ...

args.description: Date range representing activity search, if absent the default [today, today+14d] is used

args.name: regionId
args.description: Gaia region Id associated with input destination

fields.description: Flight Destination Insights query

args.name: origin
args.description: origin location of a flight

args.name: destination
args.description: destination location of a flight

args.name: origin
args.description: origin location of a flight

fields.name: cart
fields.description:
Top level cart query that looks up/creates a cart based on the context OR
performs a lookup based on the cart ID when it is present

args.name: id
args.description: The id of the cart if available

types.name: ContextInput
types.description: The input BEX context used for identifying users, sites and other platform functions

inputFields.name: clientInfo
inputFields.description: Information regarding the application which triggered the query

inputFields.name: currency
inputFields.description: Currency as Alphabetic ISO 4217 code e.g. 'USD'. Use if default currency for Locale needs to be overwritten.

inputFields.name: debugContext
inputFields.description: Debugging context, such as Abacus overrides

inputFields.name: device
inputFields.description: Client/user Device information

inputFields.name: eapid
inputFields.description: The Expedia Affiliate Partner ID

inputFields.name: identity
inputFields.description: Client/user information

inputFields.name: locale
inputFields.description: The context locale, e.g. "en_US"

inputFields.name: siteId
inputFields.description: The context Site ID, e.g. (70201 for Orbitz)

types.name: ClientInfoInput
types.description: Describe which application is invoking bex api

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of the application

inputFields.name: version
inputFields.description: Version of the application eg:18.10 or 5fbc9958

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: DebugContextInput
types.description: Context used for debugging purposes, such as overriding Abacus experiments

inputFields.name: abacusOverrides
inputFields.description: Abacus exposure overrides to be applied

types.name: ExposureInput
types.description: An exposure to an abacus experiment

inputFields.name: bucket
inputFields.description: The experiment bucket of the exposure

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The numeric Abacus ID for an experiment

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: DeviceInput
types.description: Device information

types.name: DeviceType
types.description: Valid device types

types.name: IdentityInput
types.description: Identity information for a specific user or device

inputFields.name: authState
inputFields.description: The Expedia user authenticated state

inputFields.name: duaid
inputFields.description: The device ID (DUAID)

inputFields.name: expUserId
inputFields.description: The Expedia User ID

inputFields.name: tuid
inputFields.description: The user TUID

types.name: UUID
types.description: A type representing a formatted java.util.UUID

types.name: Locale
types.description: A type representing a Locale such as en_US or fr_FR

types.name: DateInput
types.description: A common date object

inputFields.name: day
inputFields.description: The day of the month, e.g. `1` for the 1st

inputFields.name: month
inputFields.description: The numeric month, e.g. `1` for January

inputFields.name: year
inputFields.description: The four-digit year e.g. `1999`

fields.name: gallery

fields.name: offers
fields.description: Get property rooms and rates pricing

fields.name: review
fields.description: Get a single property review

args.name: id
args.description: The property review unique identifier

args.name: locale
args.description: Locale to use to translate review text using Google Translate

fields.name: reviewInfo
fields.description: Get property reviews and review summary information

args.name: end
args.description:
[Optional, Deprecated use pagination instead] Poorly named, is actually the
size of the page and NOT the endIndex. Defaults to 25

args.name: pagination
args.description: Defaults to startingIndex=0, size=25 if not specified. Takes priority over deprecated start and end inputs

args.name: start
args.description: [Optional, Deprecated use pagination instead] Beginning position of results index. Defaults to 0

fields.name: summary
fields.description: Get property summary information

fields.name: description
fields.description: The localized text describing the image

types.description: Dimensions for a presention object i.e. image or icon

types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: URL
types.description: A type representing a full protocol, host and path

fields.name: second

fields.description: Converts this date-time to the number of seconds from the epoch of 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z

fields.description: Format a with a pattern. 'd MMM uuuu' will format 2011-12-03 as '3 Dec 2011'

fields.name: raw
fields.description: Returns the posix format

fields.name: month

types.name: PropertyReviewFiltersInput
types.description: [Optional] Review results filters

inputFields.name: category
inputFields.description: Filter review results by category

inputFields.name: includeRatingsOnlyReviews
inputFields.description: Include or disclude reviews that only have ratings

inputFields.name: includeRecentReviews
inputFields.description: Get reviews immediately when true (without 90 days syndication)

inputFields.name: locale
inputFields.description: Filter review results by reviewers' locale. Example: ko_KR returns reviews made by users on Korea POSa

inputFields.name: roomTypeId
inputFields.description: Filter review results by room type

inputFields.name: searchTerm
inputFields.description: Filter review results by user provided keyword

types.name: PropertyReviewCategory
types.description: Filters review results by category type

types.name: PaginationInput
types.description: Separate a large list of results into multiple sublists

inputFields.name: size
inputFields.description: Number of results to get past the starting index

inputFields.name: startingIndex
inputFields.description: The inclusive 0-based starting index of the results. Defaults to 0

types.description: [Optional] Hotel reviews sort types. Defaults to NEWEST_TO_OLDEST_BY_LANGUAGE

types.description: Review info about the property

fields.description: The raw number value

fields.name: amenities

fields.description: Ordered list of the amenity categories

fields.name: amenitySections
fields.description:
Ordered list of the amenity sections for this property. A section with a null
subtype is a parent section and any sections with the same type and a non-null
subtype are its children

fields.description: List of brands this property belongs to, e.g. Hyatt, Marriott, etc

fields.name: fees
fields.description: The fees for this property

fields.description: The property's unique identifier

fields.description: The name of the property

fields.name: nearby

fields.name: overview

fields.name: policies

fields.description: Type of physical property, e.g. Hotel, Motel

fields.name: tagline

fields.name: telesalesPhoneNumber
fields.description: The phone number that can be used to book over the phone

fields.name: type

types.name: DestinationInput
types.description: Property search destination information

inputFields.name: coordinates
inputFields.description: The Geo location of the region to search

inputFields.name: pinnedPropertyId
inputFields.description: The property ID to use for region resolution (pinned search).

inputFields.name: propertyIds
inputFields.description: List of property IDs to return search information for.

inputFields.name: regionId
inputFields.description: The Gaia region ID of the search

inputFields.name: regionName
inputFields.description: The name of the region ID, used for fuzzy resolution

inputFields.name: latitude
inputFields.description: The latitude of the point in degrees

inputFields.name: longitude
inputFields.description: The longitude of the point in degrees

types.name: PropertySearchFiltersInput
types.description: Property search filtering options

inputFields.name: amenities
inputFields.description: Filter results by available amenities. Example: [POOL,WIFI] will return properties with a pool and wifi

inputFields.name: neighborhood
inputFields.description: Filter results by neighborhood. Input supports a valid GAIA ID

inputFields.name: price
inputFields.description: Filter results by price. Can provide a min only, a max only, or a range.

inputFields.name: priceBuckets
inputFields.description: PWA ONLY: Support for legacy PWA price buckets in the url. Use 'price' instead

inputFields.name: propertyName
inputFields.description: Filter results by user provided string

inputFields.name: reviewScore
inputFields.description: Filter results by average guest rating. Can provide a min only, a max only, or a range.

inputFields.name: showAvailableOnly
inputFields.description: Filter results by availability

inputFields.name: starList
inputFields.description: Filter results by property star rating. Example: 30, 50 returns properties rated 3 to 3.9 and 5 to 5.9

inputFields.name: stars
inputFields.description: Filter results by property star rating. Example: THREE returns properties rated 3.0+

inputFields.name: structureTypes
inputFields.description: Filter results by structure type. Example: HOTEL returns properties of structure type 'HOTEL'

inputFields.name: theme
inputFields.description: An SEM theme that needs to be passed through to other services

inputFields.name: travelerType
inputFields.description: Filter results by the type of traveler.

inputFields.name: vipOnly
inputFields.description: Filter results by VIP only properties

types.name: PriceRangeInput
types.description: Represents a range of prices for filtering properties. Follows currency rules of the user's point of sale

inputFields.name: max
inputFields.description: The maximum price, e.g. 500.00

inputFields.name: min
inputFields.description: The minimum price, e.g. 50.00

types.name: ReviewScoreRangeInput
types.description: Represents a range of review scores for filtering properties

inputFields.name: max
inputFields.description: The maximum review score, e.g. 5.0

inputFields.name: min
inputFields.description: The minimum review score, e.g. 1.0

types.name: LegacyPropertySearchCriteriaInput
types.description:
PWA ONLY: Input that is sent directly from the URL value. These inputs can not
be parsed on a server render of the PWA and must be converted in the spinner

inputFields.name: amenities
inputFields.description: Maps to PropertyFilterAmenity

inputFields.name: priceBuckets
inputFields.description: List of the price buckets to use. Starts from 0 index e.g. `[0,1,2]`

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description: Maps to PropertySort

inputFields.name: stars
inputFields.description: Maps to starList

inputFields.name: structureTypes
inputFields.description: Maps to StructureType

types.name: PropertySearchOptions
types.description: Search options that are not filters. Previously these were a large set of boolean flags in ExpWeb called `searchOptions`

enumValues.name: SHOP_WITH_POINTS
enumValues.description: Use loyalty points to calculate the strikeout price. aka `swpApplied=true`

types.name: PropertySort
types.description: Hotel sort types

types.name: PropertySearchResults
types.description: Results from a property search

fields.description: Search results specific metadata used for constructing filters

fields.name: map
fields.description: The map information for the properties returned

fields.name: properties
fields.description: The individual properties returned from the search, sorted in the order specified or in default recommended order

fields.name: searchCriteria
fields.description: The search criteria that was used after all defaults were applied

fields.name: sortAndFilter
fields.description: Sort And Filter Selected Options, Defaults if necessary, and display options

fields.name: summary
fields.description: Insights about the search results, such as the percentage of sold out inventory in the destination (aka compression)

types.description: Returns information to help inform property filter input

fields.name: structureTypes
fields.description: Returns the list of structure types available in the result set

types.description: Represents a range of prices for filtering properties. Follows currency rules of the user's point of sale

fields.name: max
fields.description: The maximum price, e.g. 500.00

fields.description: The minimum price, e.g. 50.00

fields.description: GAIA identifier of geographical region

purchase window is the number of weeks prior to the departure date.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
